page.title: 15WOODINGDEAN'S FARMING ISSUES
page.content: Crop spraying is a hard and dangerous operation.If a passer by is walking along it could get in to their lungs and do some damage in their body.The burning of stubble left by the year's crops is a sight to see.The orange,red and yellow flames glow brightly, and tiny black particles of crops land in your garden.The smoke is a bit over powering and smells and makes your eyes water.The little black particles of old crops are called smuts.When they are manure spreading you get an awful odour coming from the fields. During the late summer of 1984 the local farmers suffered criticism from many Woodingdean residents concerning stubble burning and its dangers. The local press and Southern Television became involved.
